text: Which of the following is a behavioural adaptation that protects prey from predators?
explanation:
Secreting irritating fluid is a behavioural adaptation that keep/protects preys from predators.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The period of inactivity seen in some animals during long period of heat or drought is
explanation:
Aestivation is a period of no activity seen in some animals during period of heat or drought.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The insect trapping movements of the leaves of the venus fly trap is a behavioural adaptation for
explanation:
When an insect traps movement of leaves, it is a behavioural adaptation for obtaining food.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Animals are said to gregarious when

options.A: they survive adverse conditions of cold weather
options.B: they transmit information from one individual to another
options.C: they are of the same species moving together in a group
options.D: they give an alarm to alert others to show the normal protective behaviour of the group when danger threatens

explanation:
Gregarious animals are the same species of animal moving together in group.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The type of nutrition shown by spirogyra is
explanation:
Spirogyra undergoes holophytic nutrition
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Raw materials required by green plants to manufacture their food are
explanation:
One of the raw materials needed by plants to manufacture their food is inorganic substances
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following pairs of organisms are photosynthetic?
explanation:
Euglena and chlamydomonas are photosynthetic because the possess features of plants which enables them to produce their food.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The type of nutrition in which two organisms of different species live together and derive nutrients from each other is
explanation:
Symbiotic nutrition involves two organisms of different species living together and deriving nutrients from each other
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following statement about the similarities in plant and animal transport is correct?

options.A: Materials and hormones are transported in fluid form
options.B: The transport medium is made up of only tissues
options.C: Their materials are transported in the same vessels

explanation:
One of the similarities in plant and animal transport is that materials and hormones are transported in fluid form in both.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following describes the function of lymph
explanation:
Lymph serves as body defence.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the major ways in which the blood is able to defend the body against disease causing organisms is

options.A: Absorption of fatty acids and glycerol

explanation:
One of the major ways in which the blood is able to defend against disease is clumping.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is not a transmitable character in plants
explanation:
Haemophilia is any of several hereditary illnesses that impact the body's ability to control bleeding usually passed from mother to son.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Inheritable character/features possessed by an organism can be referred to as
explanation:
Trait is an inheritable character/inheritable feature possessed by an organism.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the following is a process of transmission of hereditary characteristics by chromosomes

options.A: Genes relating to the same character occupy identical locations on the chromosomes
options.B: Separation of homologous chromosomes into four daughter cells
options.D: Dictating the formation of a protein by a gene in a chromosome

explanation:
Dictating the formation of a protein by a gene in a chromosome is a process of transmitting hereditary characteristics
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The attachment of the embryo to the wall of the uterus is called
explanation:
Implantation is the attachment of embryo to the uterus wall.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the reproductive system in mammals secretes a part of the seminal fluid which raises the pH of the fluid in the female reproductive system?
explanation:
One of the functions of the prostrate gland is to ensure the successful fertilization of the ovum which involves the neutralization of the acidic media of the male and female reproductive systems.
This does not replace the role of the cowper's gland to raise the pH of the fluid in the female reproductive system, too.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part labelled a in the above diagram is used for
explanation:
Operculum or gill cover helps the tilapia fish in gaseous exchange.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The above organism can be classified under which phylum in the animal kingdom
explanation:
The tilapia fish can be classified under chordata phylum in the animal kingdom.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One important characteristics of green plant is that they
explanation:
One of the important characteristics of green plant is that they can manufacture their food (Autotrophic).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A virus can sometimes be regarded as a living organism because it

options.A: causes diseases in plants and animals
options.B: It exists in a variety of shapes
options.C: Is easily visible with the aid of an electron microscope

explanation:
A virus is regarded as animate is because it can reproduce in living cells. It can also be inanimate when it is not in living cells.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A population is best described as

options.A: A group of the same species of organisms living together
options.B: A group of animals and plants living together
options.C: A group of insects and grasses

explanation:
A population is described as the total number of organisms of the same species living together in a given area at a particular time.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The number of times an organism occurs within a given area of a habitat is referred to as
explanation:
Population frequency refers to the number of times an organism occurs within a given area of a habitat
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Reading the verdict of a case by a magistrate is an example of
explanation:
A voluntary action is controlled by the cerebrum in the forebrain which is the largest part of the brain.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following structures controls the activities of the living cell?
explanation:
Nucleus is a part of living things which controls activities due to the presence of the DNA in it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following are components of glomerular filtrate?

options.A: All the components of blood except mineral salts
options.C: All the components of blood except plasma protein and cells
options.D: Blood cells, amino acid, salts and nitrogenous wastes

explanation:
Glomerular filtrate contains H\(_2\)O, glucose, salts and urea and it is identical to blood plasma that lacks most proteins.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The sum total of adaptive changes from pre-existing form that have taken place over a long time resulting in diversity of forms, structures and functions among organism is referred to as
explanation:
Organic evolution is the sum total of adaptive changes from pre-existing or old form that have taken place over a long time resulting in diversity of forms, structures and functions among organisms.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The specific portion of a habitat which is occupied by a particular species is referred to as
explanation:
Ecological niche refers to the specific portion of a habitat which is occupied by a particular species or organism. It is the functional position of an organism within the community.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In plants, respiration occurs in
explanation:
Respiration can either be aerobic or anaerobic respiration. Hence, in plants, all living cells take part in a form of respiration. Plant respiration is a rather diffuse process. It occurs all over the plant.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is an example of discontinuous variation?

options.A: The range in height of a pea plant from 30cm to 50cm
options.B: Offsprings including two male cats and three female cats
options.C: The colour of pear plants grown in the dark
options.D: The adult body weight ranging from 50kg to 95kg

explanation:
Discontinuous variation is the differences of variations in behaviour by which organisms can be grouped into 2 or more classes within a population without any intermediates among them e.g Behaviour, ability to roll tongue.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following type of soil has the highest water retaining capacity?
explanation:
Clay soil is the soil with highest water retaining capacity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Rabbits cannot survive in an aquatic habitat because they have
explanation:
Rabbits does not have the adaptive features of an aquatic habitat like gills therefore, it cannot survive in an aquatic habitat.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following substances pass through the root cell membrane by osmosis?
explanation:
Water passes through the root cell membrane of plant in order for osmosis to take place.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Trees in Savanna habitats usually have thick bark which mainly.
explanation:
Rate of transpiration is reduced in savannah forest due to thick barks of the trees in savannah forest.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Competition among individuals of a population increases the
explanation:
Competition one of the biotic factors in ecological factors involves the interactions among two organisms of the same species/different species which outgrows the other and survives while the other cannot grow or survive
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In natural selection, Darwin proposed that evolution occurred because of the following conditions except

options.A: that nature selects those that will survive to reproduce their kind
options.B: there is a fierce competition among the offspring
options.C: that the weaker offspring are eliminated
options.D: food and other needs are abundant

explanation:
In natural selection, Darwin proposed that evolution occurred because of the following conditions except food and other needs are abundant
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following substances has the highest amount of energy in joules per unit weight?
explanation:
Fats provides more energy to animal than carbohydrates therefore containing the highest amount of energy in joules per unit weight.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following pairs of scientists discovered the Rhesus factor in human blood?
explanation:
Landsteiner and Lavine are scientist, they discovered the Rhesus factor in human blood.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The study of an individual organism or a single species of organism and its environment is
explanation:
Autecology is the study of an individual organism or a single specie of organism and no environment
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is a nitrifying bacterium?
explanation:
Nitrobacter are chemoautrophic organisms found in soil and water responsible for the oxidation of ammonium to nitrite and nitrite to nitrate.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is the effect of using artificial pollination in plant breeding?

options.B: Lengthening the maturity time of crops
options.D: Improvement of the variety of crops

explanation:
One of the effect of using artificial pollination in plant breeding is that it improves the variety of crops.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Only specially adapted micro-organisms are found in
explanation:
Halophiles are organisms that thrive in high salt concentrations. The adaptations of halophile organisms to their environment are:
(a) The integrity of non-halophile macromolecules is compromised, and the flow of water out of the cell produces a Turgor effect. • (b) Moderate halophiles maintain their structures via the synthesis of compatible organic solutes. • (c) Extreme halophiles maintain their structures via equilibration of cellular and environmental salt concentrations.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Plants which can survive in extremely dry places are called
explanation:
They are called Xerophyte because they are species of plant that has adaptations/adaptive features like waxy cuticles which enables them to survive in extremely dry land.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The presence of ______ for swimming in a tad-pole enables it to adapt in an aquatic habitat.
explanation:
Tadpole's ability to swim and adapt to an aquatic habitat is due to the presence of its tail.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Possession of thin membrane enables a tapeworm to

options.A: Fasten themselves to the wall of the host's intestine
options.C: Absorb digested food from the host's intestine to their system
options.D: Shield themselves inside the host's intestine with anti-enzymes in order to avoid being digested

explanation:
The tapeworm possesses a thin membrane mostly because of it absorption of digested food from the intestine of the host.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following juices contains the enzyme ptyalin?
explanation:
The saliva contains an enzyme called ptyalin which helps to hydrolysis of starch to maltose partially
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following essential substance is contained in vegetable?
explanation:
Vegetable contains mineral salts like magnesium, copper etc which is very essential for body growth.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Good quality food will perform the following functions in human except
explanation:
Good quality food cannot provide resistance to malaria because it does not contain anti-malaria substance it only and good propr growth.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is considered to be the first product of Photosynthesis?
explanation:
Starch is the main and first product formed during photosynthesis because the simple sugar formed is partly used by the plant and excess of it is converted into starch immediately for storage and the starch is transported to other parts of the plant through the phloem vessels for storage.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the blood corpusles are irregular and amoeloid in shape
explanation:
Leucocytes are also called white blood cell. They are irregular and amoebaoid in shape.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which organ removes the largest quantity of water from the blood?
explanation:
Kidney is an organ that perform lots of function one of which it helps in removing large quantity of water from the blood in order to maintain normal balance in the body system
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The movement of blood between the heart and all other parts of the body beside the lungs is
explanation:
Systemic circulation involves the movement of blood between the heart and all other parts of the body besides the lungs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The change in the genetic make up of an organism resulting in an inheritable characteristics which is new is
explanation:
Mutation involves the changes in the genes of an organism due to some factors resulting in a new character that can be inherited.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The organic molecule(s) present in the nucleus is/are
explanation:
DNA is located in the nucleus of cells. It is responsible for the storage of organisms's hereditary traits and helps in directing the day to day metabolic activities of each cell in the organic.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Albinism is an expression of trait controlled by
explanation:
Albinism is the condition in which the skin of an animal is non-pigmented because of lack of the pigment called Melanin. It is controlled by Recessive genes.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The male sex cells also called gametes are produced in the testes by a process called
explanation:
Spermatogenesis is the process whereby male sex cells or gametes (sperms) are produced in the testis.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following describes an example of fertilization in higher organisms

options.A: Fusion of sperm and egg nuclei
options.B: Pollen grain landing on a sticky stigma
options.C: Ejaculation of the egg and pollen grain
options.D: Ejaculation of sperm into the female body

explanation:
Fusion of sperm and egg nuclei is an example of fertilization in mammals.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part labeled III in the above diagram is
explanation:
Hyphae in a mushroom is a vegetative body parts made up of time and delicate thread containing nuclei
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The organism above can be found in
explanation:
It is found in moist environment because of its adaptive features.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The possession of chloroplast in Euglena virids enables it to
explanation:
Euglena vivids possesses chloroplast (plants feature) in order for it to carry out photosynthesis
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Viruses are pathogens of the following diseases except
explanation:
Tuberculosis is classified under diseases causes by bacteria not virus.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The association between two organisms living together in which only one benefits from the association while the other is neither benefited nor harmed is
explanation:
Commensalism is the association between 2 organisms living together in which only one benefits from the association while the other is neither benefited nor harmed e.g Ramora fish and shark. Commensalism is an example of symbiotic Association.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following will have the least effect on the rate of change of the numbers in a population
explanation:
Mutation involves the changes in the gene resulting in an inheritable character, therefore not having effect on the rate of change of the numbers in a population.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following controls all voluntary actions
explanation:
Cerebrum is the largest part of the brain and it controls all voluntary actions like speech, dancing etc and also concerned with the concentration and co-ordination of impulses.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following statement describes an autonomic nervous system

options.C: It dials with external stimuli and their responses
options.D: It affects glands, cardia muscles and smooth muscles

explanation:
Autonomic nervous system is concerned with the control of the body's involuntary activities e.g breathing, heartbeat, digestion etc
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The glomerular filtrate contains the following except
explanation:
The glomerulus helps in the mechanism of excretion (formation of urine) in mammals. It does not contain the blood corpuscles.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the following is not the theory of natural selection stated by Charles Dawin

options.A: Characteristics acquired through use or disuse are transmitted offspring
options.B: Variations appear by themselves in a population
options.C: Heredity variations are transmitted to offspring
options.D: Species that are the fittest for the environment contribute more offsprings to the next needs of the generation

explanation:
Charles Darwins theory is that of natural selection not of use and disuse
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Ecology is best defined as the study of

options.B: The inter-relationship between living organisms and the environment
options.C: Living organisms in a particular area

explanation:
Ecology is best defined as the study of the inter-relationship between living organisms and the environment.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The following processes are involved during expiration in man except

options.B: The thoracic cavity first increases in volume
options.D: The ribs are moved downwards and inwards

explanation:
During respiration process in man under expiration process the thoracic cavity does not increase in volume
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is an example of continous variation?
explanation:
Continuous variations are variations which change gradually within a population e.g height in humans.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the following is an effect of clay soil on vegetation

options.A: Supports luxuriant vegetation such as forest

explanation:
Clay soil's effect on vegetation is that it supports light vegetation such as scanty vegetation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following factors is not considered in a terrestial habitat?
explanation:
Turbidity is not a factor in terrestrial habitat it is a factor in aquatic habitat because turbidity also means cloudy which is an aquatic factor.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What type of vertebrate assists in breathing alongside with the ribs?
explanation:
Thoracic cavity assists in breathing alongside the ribs because it is found in the chest region.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following statement is correct about Southern Guinea Savanna in Nigeria

options.A: It is the largest of all the biotic community in Nigeria
options.C: It has plants species like Iroko, Opepe etc

explanation:
Southern Guinea Savanna is the largest of all biotic community in Nigeria found in Oyo, Osun, Ekiti Status etc.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In an ecosystem, the organism which changes light energy into stored chemical energy is the
explanation:
In an ecosystem the organism which changes light energy into stored chemical energy is the producer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the theory of use and disuse Lamarck proposed that evolution occurred because of the following except

options.A: There is natural selection of offspring
options.B: There is great changes in the environment

explanation:
In the theory of use and disuse by Lamarck Jean he did not propose that there is natural selection of offspring.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The basis of growth involves the following processes except
explanation:
During the process of growth the cell does not reduce, it divides, enlarges and differentiates.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following organs can be considered vestigial in humans but functional in other mammals
explanation:
Vestigial organs are remaining parts of one's functioning organ e.g appendix in human which function as caecum in herbivore which are minute and are incomplete organs with no special function.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The study which involves the inter-relationship between groups of organisms or species of organisms living together in an area is
explanation:
Synecology involves the inter-relationship between groups of organism or species of organisms living together in an area.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Thunderstorm can be beneficial to plants because it

options.B: kills the pest that attacks crops
options.C: destroys some of the major crops

explanation:
One of the process in which nutrient is fixed into the soil is electrical discharge which helps to add nutrient and nitrate to the soil.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A flowering plant having both the male and female flowers on the same plant is said to be
explanation:
Flowering plants having both the male and female flowers on the same flower are called Monoecious plants
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
